com.foreach.across.modules.entity.bind

Interface EntityPropertyBinder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ListEntityPropertyBinder, MapEntityPropertyBinder, SingleEntityPropertyBinder

    public interface EntityPropertyBinder
    Basic binder interface for a single property of an entity, allowing access to the property value, updating the value, validating it and saving it.

    Dispatches to the EntityPropertyController for the actual handling.

    Mainly for internal use in EntityModule.

    Since:
    3.2.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    EntityPropertiesBinder

    • Method Detail

      • getItemKey

        String getItemKey()
        Contains the item key for this property binder. Only set and relevant in case the binder is a member of a collection, represented by a parent ListEntityPropertyBinder.
        Returns:
        item key - only set when part of a ListEntityPropertyBinder

      • getSortIndex

        long getSortIndex()
        Returns:
        Sort index value, only relevant when the property value is part of a (sorted) collection.

      • setSortIndex

        void setSortIndex(long sortIndex)
        Set the sort index of a property, only relevant when part of a sorted collection.
        Parameters:
        sortIndex - of this property

      • setBound

        void setBound(boolean bound)
        Set the value of this property as bound using a data binder. This usually signals that a property was present in a web form. Usually setting this to true means that the property value should be deleted if no actual value has been set.

      • isBound

        boolean isBound()
        Returns:
        has this property been bound

      • getControllerOrder

        int getControllerOrder()
        Returns:
        the order in which controller methods of this property should be executed relative to all other properties (and the base entity itself)

      • getOriginalValue

        Object getOriginalValue()
        Get the original value which was present before binding changes.
        Returns:
        the original value that was present before

      • getValue

        Object getValue()
        Returns:
        the current value

      • getInitializedValue

        Object getInitializedValue()
        Get the current value or initialize a new value if it has not been set. Use this method if you want to create intermediate bean paths because you want to update underlying properties of the entity.

        Using getInitializedValue() will also delegate any existing value to EntityPropertyController.createDto(EntityPropertyBindingContext, Object) for creating a DTO object that can be safely updated without directly applying the changes to the underlying entity it possibly represents.

        Returns:
        the value and initialize a new value if necessary
        See Also:
        createNewValue(), EntityPropertyController.createDto(EntityPropertyBindingContext, Object)

      • setValue

        void setValue(Object value)
        Update the value.
        Parameters:
        value - to set

      • setDeleted

        void setDeleted(boolean deleted)
        Explicitly set this property as deleted. The value returned will usually be null.
        Parameters:
        deleted - true if property should be considered deleted

      • isDeleted

        boolean isDeleted()
        Returns:
        true if the property is considered deleted

      • isModified

        boolean isModified()
        Check if the property that this binder represents has been modified.
        Returns:
        true if the property has been modified, a deleted property is usually also considered modified

      • isDirty

        boolean isDirty()
        Check if this property has possibly been modified since the previous call to applyValue().
        Returns:
        true if the property is dirty

      • createNewValue

        Object createNewValue()
        Initialize a new value for this property. Will not actually update the property value itself but will attempt to return a new instance that can be set as the value.
        Returns:
        new value, can be null

      • applyValue

        boolean applyValue()
        Apply the current property value to the owning entity by calling EntityPropertyController.applyValue(EntityPropertyBindingContext, EntityPropertyValue). If the property is considered deleted, the value of EntityPropertyValue.isDeleted() will be true.
        Returns:
        true if value has been applied

      • save

        boolean save()
        Calls the EntityPropertyController.save(EntityPropertyBindingContext, EntityPropertyValue) for the given property.
        Returns:
        true if save has been executed

      • validate

        boolean validate(org.springframework.validation.Errors errors,
                 Object... validationHints)
        Validate this property value.
        Parameters:
        errors - object in which to register the errors
        validationHints - to customize validation rules
        Returns:
        true if validation was successful, no validation errors have been added for this property

      • resolvePropertyBinder

        EntityPropertyBinder resolvePropertyBinder(@NonNull
                                           @NonNull EntityPropertyDescriptor descriptor)
        Attempt to resolve a child property binder for the given property descriptor. The descriptor is expected to represent either the same property the current binder is for, or a child property.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - for the property you want to resolve
        Returns:
        property binder

      • enableBinding

        default void enableBinding(boolean enabled)
        Enable binding for this property. This signals that property binding is in progress, which allows implementations (like ListEntityPropertyBinder and MapEntityPropertyBinder) to make decisions on how to consider the current state of its property value.

        For example when accessing ListEntityPropertyBinder.getItems() while binding is active, the item list might be empty as it should be reset. When binding is no longer active but no calls have been made to the property, the items collection will not have modified and the original value will be returned.
